data.title: Lamar University History Department Oral History Collection
data.meta_description: This is a collection of materials complied by over 300 history students who were conducting oral histories as part of their course work in the history department at Lamar University.
data.text:
1 - 50 | 51 - 100 | 101 - 150 | 151 - 200 | 201 - 250 | 251 - 300 | 301 - 350 | 351 - 382 |

Box 1

Subject: Depression Era Experiences (including the closing of the sawmill at Oakhurst in San Jacinto County, Mrs. Fletcher’s admiration of President Franklin Roosevelt)

Interviewee: Geneva Mae Fletcher

1 Interviewer: Linda Cartwright

Date November 2, 1990

Subject: Ethnic History (Experience of a Mexican immigrant in Port Arthur, Texas and in Mexico from the 1930s – 1950s)

Interviewee: Mercedes Barbosa

2 Interviewer: Shannon M. Daigle

Date: November 7, 1990

Subject: Depression Era Experiences (Rationing in World War II and daily life in Port Arthur, Texas in the 1930s)

Interviewee: Dellora Rodriguez

3 Interviewer: Susan Danner

Date: November 8. 1990

Subject: World War II Experiences and German Internment Camps (German Internment Camps in the Monroe City area of Chambers County and the reality of how rationing worked in World War II)

Interviewee: Curtis Penick

4 Interviewer: Becky Fancher

Date: November 4, 1990

Subject: World War II (Life on the home front in Houston during World War II including mock air raids and rationing)

Interviewee: Maudell B. Eiland

5 Interviewer: Susan F. Matthews

Date: October 20, 1990

Subject: Depression Era Experiences (Life among the well- to-do in Dayton, Texas)

Interviewee: Mrs. Eva Uncle

6 Interviewer: Ruth Mika

Date: November 4, 1990

Subject: World War II History (B-24 bomber bombing crew in World War II, prisoner of war in Germany, plane crash and parachuting to safety, life in the prisoner of war camp, forced march and medical care)

Interviewee: Louis J. Deslatte

7 Interviewer: Brenda Rebert

Date: November 9, 1988

Subject: Depression Era Experiences (Depression and World War II, making a living during the Depression through the production and sale of illegal alcohol and the Beaumont police force)

Interviewee: Robert E. Sterling, Sr.

8 Interviewer: Peggy Scarborough

Date: October 25, 1990

Subject: World War II (Submarine warfare in the Gulf of Mexico, rationing and the black market)

Interviewee: Gladys Price

9 Interviewer: Jan Street

Date: November 6, 1990

Subject: Ethnic History (Mr. Lacy working his way through Prairie View A & M, serving in the Navy during World War II, playing baseball in the Negro League and integration of schools in Jasper, Texas)

Interviewee: Raymon Lacy

10 Interviewer: Gina Walkoviak

Date: October 31, 1990

Subject: An Interview with Mrs. Edna Jean Fett: The Depression (Social Life of young people in 1930s Beaumont, growth and change of Lamar University

Date: November 9, 1990

Subject: William Gerald Simpson (Depression and World War II, segregation, black market in France during World War II and making ends meet in the Depression)

12 Interviewer: Sherman White

Date: November 4, 1990

Subject: Depression Era and World War I Experience (Public works programs, bank closings, the Depression and Tuskegee Institute, segregation and poll tax, Franklin and Eleanor Roosevelt visits to Tuskegee Institute)

13 Interviewer: Hattie Abbot

Date: November 26, 1989

Subject: Depression Era Experiences (Drilling for oil at Spindletop during the 1920s and the challenges of automobile travel in the teens and twenties)

14 Interviewer: Marilyn Mattox Anders

Date: November 23, 1989

Subject: Depression Era Experiences (Depression at Gainesville, Texas, the Beaumont Race Riot, working to earn money for education at Prairie View A & M and restrictions on school teachers)

15 Interviewer: Deborah L. Barideaux

Date: November 21, 1989
